title: How to Make Arroz Chaufa

steps.headline: Take a good amount of scallions.
steps.description: Remove the heads (as shown in picture above) and wash them, removing and loose layers from the top, slice larger for the chicken/sauce and smaller for the rice.

steps.headline: Wash bell pepper, slice in half.
steps.description: Remove the seeds and the white insides and slice vertically to keep width, use picture as reference.

steps.headline: Peel onion and slice in half.
steps.description: Cut the onion in thick pieces and remove layers by hand into bowl (as shown in picture below).

steps.headline: Wash chicken, butterfly (meaning if the chicken is too thick, cut the thickness in half) then cut into 1 inch width sized strips.
steps.description: Make sure that everything else is cut before you continue with this step. Cutting meat on the same cutting board as the vegetables can contaminate the vegetables and cause food poisoning or other sickness.

steps.headline: Cut the garlic and add  it to the bowl with the chicken.
Mix the soy sauce with the chicken.
steps.description: Add garlic and soy sauce to the bowl of chicken and mix thoroughly. Let that sit and marinate for about 15 minutes.

steps.headline: Break all the eggs into a bowl and add a small amount of milk and the pinch of salt.
steps.description: Mix thoroughly with a whisk or a fork.

steps.headline: Starting on a high flame, add canola oil to a pan and let it heat.
steps.description: Once the pan is hot add mixture and wait about six to seven minutes. Watch the eggs throughout this, lowering heat and poking small holes into it with the spatula in order to let the uncooked liquid into the heat. Right before it is fully cooked, cut the egg into quarters and one by one flipping the quarters to let the other side cook. This side will cook much faster so be ready to remove it in about 30 seconds. Once removed put it onto a plate. Slice the egg into small one-inch pieces, as shown in the picture. Don't wash the pan yet; you will need it again later on.

steps.headline: Remove bacon from packaging, keep together and slice according to the picture, afterward place in bowl.
steps.description: The bacon will be easier to cut if it is chilled so it would be best to keep it in the fridge until this step.

steps.headline: Add the ketchup, the white vinegar, the soy sauce, the Worcester sauce, the garlic and the pineapple juice in a bowl.
steps.description: Mix thoroughly with a whisk or a fork. Make sure you don’t add more white vinegar than specified because the flavor is very strong and could ruin the sauce.

steps.headline: Begin cooking once everything is prepared.
steps.description: This is a very delicate process. It is very easy to mess this up, so follow these steps exactly as they are written.

steps.headline: Heat the pan on medium to high heat and add the bacon, mixing it slightly every couple minutes.
steps.description: Depending on the kind of bacon you use, you may want to add a small amount of canola oil to help it if it doesn't have enough grease on its own. Let that cook until it becomes light brown. You don’t want the bacon to be too thick due to the fact that it won’t cook properly because it won’t have enough grease.

steps.headline: Once the bacon has browned slightly, add the fried rice seasoning mix and mix until it looks evenly distributed.
steps.description: Once it browns a little more remove pan and let sit on metal sheet.

steps.headline: Take the deep pan and add a non-stick spray at the bottom of the pan and put the chicken to cook on high flame and half way through the chicken cooking, add the onions and lower to a medium flame.
steps.description: The chicken should be brown all around after several minutes of sitting and flipping occasionally. Once the onions are in, let that sit and the flavors will mix after another couple of minutes.

steps.headline: Add the bell pepper and allow the flavors to mix once again like the onions.
steps.description: Once this has sat again add the sauce to the mix, now stirring the mixture together. NOTE: While it may seem that the sauce may not be enough, eventually the juices from the chicken and the vegetables will add to the total and give a good orange color.

steps.headline: Add about eight cups of water to the pot and set on the stove to boil.
Add the rice to a bowl and wash it, mixing the rice slightly before draining the water.
steps.description: You can use a strainer to drain the water from the rice. Repeat this and once the water has drained a second time add it to the pot that should now be beginning to boil.

steps.headline: Let it sit and boil for about 10-15 minutes.
steps.description: Do not look into the pot during this time. You should be able to hear the pot boiling after some time, once that happens turn down the heat and let it sit for around 20 minutes.

steps.headline: Put the water in the pot and add some garlic and canola oil.
steps.description: Then let it sit on the heat. Make sure you taste a bit of the rice every so often so you know when to stop cooking it. If the rice is still crunchy when you taste it, then you have to keep cooking the rice.

steps.headline: After cooking the sauce together for some time, begin to turn the heat gradually lower until it hits low.
steps.description: If you want to make the sauce thicker you may want to add a teaspoon of flour to a cup of water and mix thoroughly (optional step).

steps.headline: Add to the sauce and stir.
steps.description: Let that sit as you prepare the rice. Put the pan of bacon back on the stove and turn the heat on to heat it back up. If the rice is finished take it off the stove and put it on a large platter or metal sheet. Sometimes the rice may stick to these platters, if you wish to avoid this you can place aluminum foil over the platter and the rice on top of that.

steps.headline: Spread it evenly across, then pour soy sauce across the rice until it covers a good amount.
steps.description: After this mix the rice with some utensils until it has an even brown coloring. Add the bacon and the eggs to the rice and mix so that it is well distributed. Take the smaller cut scallions and mix them into the rice as well.

You don’t want the bacon to be too thick due to the fact that it won’t cook properly because it won’t have enough grease. Take the deep pan and add a non-stick spray at the bottom of the pan and put the chicken to cook on high flame and half way through the chicken cooking, add the onions and lower to a medium flame. Add about eight cups of water to the pot and set on the stove to boil.  Add the rice to a bowl and wash it, mixing the rice slightly before draining the water. You can use a strainer to drain the water from the rice. Repeat this and once the water has drained a second time add it to the pot that should now be beginning to boil. Let it sit and boil for about 10-15 minutes. Do not look into the pot during this time. You should be able to hear the pot boiling after some time, once that happens turn down the heat and let it sit for around 20 minutes. Put the water in the pot and add some garlic and canola oil. Then let it sit on the heat. Make sure you taste a bit of the rice every so often so you know when to stop cooking it. If the rice is still crunchy when you taste it, then you have to keep cooking the rice. After cooking the sauce together for some time, begin to turn the heat gradually lower until it hits low. If you want to make the sauce thicker you may want to add a teaspoon of flour to a cup of water and mix thoroughly (optional step). Add to the sauce and stir. Let that sit as you prepare the rice. Put the pan of bacon back on the stove and turn the heat on to heat it back up. If the rice is finished take it off the stove and put it on a large platter or metal sheet. Sometimes the rice may stick to these platters, if you wish to avoid this you can place aluminum foil over the platter and the rice on top of that. Spread it evenly across, then pour soy sauce across the rice until it covers a good amount. After this mix the rice with some utensils until it has an even brown coloring. Add the bacon and the eggs to the rice and mix so that it is well distributed. Take the smaller cut scallions and mix them into the rice as well.
